Description: Heavily corroded iron hatchet- adze-head or pitching chisel with a rectangular thick blade of rectangular cross-section, with slightly convex lateral edges, and a thick axial tang of square cross-section, which was clearly fastened in a mortise at one end of a perpendicular wooden haft. The cutting edge and part of one side are broken and missing.
Curator's comments: "Axe (fig. 24) (...) of a different type to that of Naukratis, which had a socket", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 78 § 78, p. 110.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 24)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.47, p.76, p.184, pl.26)
